description: Construction of third and fourth floor levels to three storey building to accommodate additional residential unit (1 x 3 bed) with balcony and roof terraces, and insertion of door to frontage of ground floor flat.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): 786/TB/PP-012 Rev B  (proposed block and floor plans); 786/TB/PP-013 Rev B (proposed elevations and sections); 786/TB/PP-014 Rev B (proposed materiality elevations); 786/TB/PP-015 Rev B (proposed 3D); 786/TB/PP-020 (green wall details)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match those of the existing building unless indicated on the approved plans or application form.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016);  Publication London Plan(2020) policies D1, D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); Publication London Plan(2020) policies D1, D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| Windows to the back of the development shall contain obscure glazing from 1.7m above internal floor level and shall be top opening only. And shall be retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To safeguard neighbouring amenity in accordance with  7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); Publication London Plan(2020) policies D1, D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); policies D1, D3 and D4 of the Publication London Plan(2020), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019)

| Notwithstanding the approved green infrastructure which has been designed as part of the schemes acceptability, a five (5) year management and maintenance plan for the planting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authrority prior to first occupations of the scheme.
The management plan shall include:
- Supervisory, reporting arrangements and maintenance schedules
- An irrigation/watering time table for each type planting i.e. for climber and planted beds
- A schedule for seasonal maintenance of the landscaping with appropriate support systems and health checking of planting to ensure it is performing as intended

The approved planting shall be maintained in situ in perpetuity of the development as approved. Any planting that is part of the approved scheme that within a period of five years after planting is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season and all planting shall be replaced with others of a similar size and species and in the same position, and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the development urban greening for the visual amenity of the building and area and in the interests of providing a sustainable environment for future occupiers of the development in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 7.4 and 7.5 of the London Plan (2016);  Publication London Plan(2020) policies D1, D3 and D4 ; The London Environment Strategy (2018); and policies 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019)

| Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment (according to standards of SPG10) shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise levels from transport and industrial/commercial/ cultural sources. Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise) to achieve internal room standards of SPG10 and noise limits specified by BS8233:2014. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Publication London Plan(2020) policy D14; The London Plan (2016) policy 7.15;  Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019)

| The site is within the worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57/60 dB). Before the development is commenced, details shall be submitted for approval by the Council in writing, for the insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, which will achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms, as specified in Supplementary Planning Guidance 10. The details should also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation in accordance with Authority 92dbs criteria. The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2016), Policy D14 of the Publication London Plan;  Ealin'sg SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | A Construction Method Statement and Construction Management Plan Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting (91Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light=92 by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays,
- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy T7 of the Publicaion London Plan(2020) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.
| At least seven (7) secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site and retained thereafter
Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2016) policy 6.9 and table 6.3; and Publication London Plan(2020) policy T5 and table 10.2

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within an enclosure has been provided as shown on the approved plans.  Waste storage capacity shall be provided in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards; and shall be retained.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); and Publicaton London Plan(2020) table 3.2.
